keyEvents.title: Neptune's Self-Imposed Isolation
keyEvents.description: King Neptune locks himself in Hard-Shell Tower to wrestle with his grief and rage over Otohime's assassination. His ministers stay with him to ensure he calms down before emerging.
keyEvents.significance: The tower serves as a physical representation of Neptune's internal struggle between vengeance and peace, becoming a sanctuary where he can process his emotions without acting on his violent impulses.

description: A secure tower within Ryugu Palace where King Neptune isolated himself after Queen Otohime's assassination to prevent himself from acting on his desire for revenge.
culturalSignificance: Represents the internal struggle between justice and vengeance, and the difficulty of maintaining peaceful ideals in the face of tragedy.

keyEvents.title: Nami Forgives Jinbe
keyEvents.description: In the Sea Forest, Nami forgives Jinbe for his connection to Arlong after hearing the full history of Fish-Man Island. The emotional moment brings Jinbe and Hatchan to tears.
keyEvents.significance: The Sea Forest serves as the location for this pivotal character development moment, where past wounds begin to heal and new alliances are forged.

keyEvents.title: Sanji Kicks Luffy
keyEvents.description: Sanji kicks Luffy for sleeping through Jinbe's entire emotional backstory about Fish-Man Island's history.
keyEvents.significance: A comedic moment that showcases the Straw Hats' crew dynamics in this historically significant location.

keyEvents.title: Hatchan's Warning
keyEvents.description: Hatchan explains Hody Jones' extremist hatred and warns about his plan to disrupt the World Summit.
keyEvents.significance: The Sea Forest becomes the location where the Straw Hats learn about the scope of Hody's threat.

keyEvents.title: Hody's Broadcast Reaches the Sea Forest
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats witness Hody Jones' island-wide broadcast announcing the New Fish-Man Pirates' takeover while in the Sea Forest.
keyEvents.significance: The broadcast reaches even this remote location, showing the comprehensive nature of Hody's communication strategy.

description: A sunlit forest at the bottom of the sea on Fish-Man Island, historically significant as a gathering place and location for important conversations.
culturalSignificance: A place of historical significance where important conversations and revelations occur, including the site of multiple pivotal moments in Fish-Man Island's history.

keyEvents.title: Hody Displays Framed Assassin
keyEvents.description: In a flashback, Hody Jones presents the body of a human pirate at Gyoncorde Plaza, claiming he killed Queen Otohime, to incite anti-human sentiment among the grieving population.
keyEvents.significance: The plaza, previously a site of hope where Otohime gathered signatures for peaceful coexistence, becomes a site of manipulation where her death is weaponized to incite the very hatred she fought against.

description: A major public plaza on Fish-Man Island where Queen Otohime held rallies for human-fish-man coexistence, and later where the aftermath of her assassination was manipulated by Hody Jones.
culturalSignificance: A site of both hope and tragedy - where Otohime's peace movement gathered momentum and where her death was exploited to undermine her ideals.
